entry.title: Read Change Documents in SAP MDG from Change Request Number (CR)
entry.content:
Techniques for reading change documents in SAP MDG, and interpreting the change documents is the key. Below are few methods which can help to read the Change Documents:

1. Through API (CL_USMD_ADAPTER_PROVIDER): This API helps in reading the change documents which can be utilised as per your business scenario eg: Route the Workflow (BRF+ WF) to a different user if a specific field is updated by the requestor. Attached is the code snippet (Code for API Method.txt) that can be used to read the change documents.

2. Through SAP Change Documents Tables (CDPOS/CDHDR)

2.1. Get CR number 

2.2. Pass this to CDHDR table as shown below

2.3 You will see two entries as below, Change Numbers (CDHDR-CHANGENR) can be picked from here

2.4 Pass the change number from CDHDR (Step 2.3), into table CDPOS to get the details of the changed fields

You will see the old and new value for a field as below:

2.5 If MDG Change Pointers are active in your system, then actual material number (Object Key) will be available in the table MDGD_CP, and this can be read based on CR number and Object Type as shown below:

Feel free to share your thoughts, questions, or any experiences you may have had with SAP MDG Change Documents. 

I would like to thanks my colleague Bijal Parmar (Bijal.Parmar@sap.com) for sharing useful information.

Thank You, Keep Learning!!

entry.title: Part 6 - SAP MDG – A Stepping Stone for SAP S/4HANA Journey - Validation & Derivation
entry.content:
Introduction

Clients across the globe are getting into the transformation journey started with SAP S/4HANA.

While we are discussing the use case: the master data (MDG) journey be the stepping stone for SAP S/4HANA Transformation and the needed steps to achieve it,

In this blog, we will focus on the MDG components: Validation & Derivation

This is the 6th blog in this series. Please go through the previous parts in the given below link

Part 1 : https://blogs.sap.com/2023/01/27/sap-mdg-a-stepping-stone-for-sap-s-4hana-journey-part-i/

Part 5 : https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blogs-by-members/part-5-sap-mdg-a-stepping-stone-for-sap-s-4hana-journey/ba-p/13747016

B.4 Validation & Derivation

Having the right data created/managed is a key success criteria for the governance system.

Validation: Applying the business rules to ensure the data is compiled to it

Derivation: Ability to auto-fill the data based on the defined business rules. This will help to reduce the manual efforts for data fill and avoid human errors ensuring high data quality.

In this section, we will discuss the various approaches for MDG validation & derivation flexibility to fulfil the needs

Validation

Business Rules: In the data dictionary ( Data model) , there needs discussion with business  to define rules for each fields.

This is a key activity and fundamental to keep the data at the highest quality and monitor it.

Below are few common scenarios for validating the data

  • Field Status Checks

Field status checks- Mandatory/optional ( discussed on part 3) for each field needs to be validated by the system and accordingly the error message to the triggered

Approach : The field status table entries needs to be read through the BADI and validate against the staging layer for the specific CR.

If any of the status fails ( Ex. A mandatory field is missing data ), then error message to the triggered

It is also possible to define a warning message which can be overwritten by the user.

  • Business rules :

An example : If the payment method is EFT, then the bank details needs to be maintained.

There are BADI’s where the needed code can be written to achieve the validation including the conditional mandatory as per the example

Derivation

Master data entry would be time-consuming work and it can be prone to human error. Having fields derived from business rules would save time and ensure the data quality

Requirements

As discussed in previous blog, based on the segments, markets & account group the requirements differ.

Ex. For wholesalers in a particular country, the field values for few fields such as reconciliation account, payment terms need to be the same, and they have to be derived.

MDG Derivation Framework

For solution approach, we will be considering the framework concept to accommodate various scenarios and fields to be derived

Control Table

In the control table build on MDG, a sample requirements have been build.

An quick overview of the the table

  • CR Type – Business process such as Create.
  • Account Group – Defined account groups
  • Org Level Company code - the segment and market are considered as the company code. Enterprise Structure is the key thing to be understood it well to see if this suits.
  • Field Name – Field which needs to be derived
  • Field Value – Value which needs to be derived

There are cases, only company code might not be enough. It might need to add Sales Org as well.

SAP MDG offers various derivation solution through which we can manage the requirements. For this requirements, the dynamic derivation concept will be taken up. A control table is to be built up to have the combination set up which will be read by the derivation Badi for derivation

In the table, each row acts as a specific derivation. As part of the creation CR process, based on the values entered ( Account Group, CC) , the needed fields will be derived.

Using this approach, a generic derivation framework is set it up which can able to cater to various fields with lots of combinations

If there is new requirement later : where a new field to be derived or change in existing ,it needs an entry update in the control table without any developments

Similar entries need to be built for each business process if needed.

 Other Key Requirements : Copy from existing records

 There are cases in which not all fields can be derived from the above derivation framework solution due to limitation

This calls for a requirement of copying from existing records to edit.

Possible Solution :

By sap standard , not all fields are copied using the copy functionality provided out of the box.

So it needs development to ensure the needed fields coverage . It needs a clear requirements for the list of fields to be copied

Some clients have template customers – not real customer record but created with the needed information for various scenarios.

Rather than copying from a real customer, template customers can be used to copy excluding Name & Address data.

Key Things

  • With MDG acts a central system for data collection, enrichment and approval, its important to derive/validate the data to ensure the data quality
  • SAP MDG offers Data Quality Management where rules mining and other latest functionalities are available

In the next blog, I will cover other topics in detail.

About the Author,

Antony Prasanna has been working in SAP master data space since 2006. Have experience working across multiple large transformation programs on SAP S/4HANA including SAP MDM, MDG and Data Migration tools.

entry.title: Securing Business Partner (BP) Master Data in SAP S/4HANA: A Guide to Field-Level Authorization
entry.content:
Problem Statement

When we have MDG implemented for supplier and customer. All the master data changes for supplier and customer must go through the MDG workflow process and data must not be editable in S/4 system directly, however, there are a few exceptions where specific fields must be managed directly in S4. Due to this we must build our S4 role in such a way that all the MDG managed data / fields must be restricted only to display and only S4 managed fields should be editable.

Implementing The Solution:

Usually in S4 all the business partner data is managed through either transaction BP or the Fiori app F3163 - Manage Business Partner Master Data. The solution we are going to discuss here only works with transaction code BP but not with Fiori apps.

Preparing a requirement matrix:

We should start with identifying which fields / data is MDG managed vs S4 managed. To get this, we should work with the master data team. They can help us with identifying the field level requirements like below with reference to master data dictionary.

 

Technical Filed Name

Business Name

MDG/S4

KNA1.NAME4

Attention (aka Name 4)

S4

KNBK.BANKL

Bank Number

S4

ADRC.STREET

Address Line 1

MDG

KNA1.KDKG1

Customer condition group 1 (Line discount)

S4

KNA1.KDKG2

Customer condition group 2 (Multi line discount)

S4

KNBK.BANKN

Bank Account Number

MDG

KNBK.BANKS

Bank Country Key

MDG

Preparing role matrix:

Now we should prepare a role matrix in line with identified S4 managed fields / data

 

Technical Filed Name

Business Name

Role1

Role2

KNA1.NAME4

Attention (aka Name 4)

X

 

KNBK.BANKL

Bank Number

X

 

KNA1.KDKG1

Customer condition group 1 (Line discount)

 

X

KNA1.KDKG2

Customer condition group 2 (Multi line discount)

 

X

 Identifying the field group ID:

Next step is to Identify the field group IDs, which will be used in authorization object (B_BUPA_FDG) to restrict the access to fields.

 Steps: 

  • Go to SE16 transaction
  • Enter table name “TBZ3R” and execute
  • Filter out using technical filed name

 

 

Marking fields as authorization relevant:

In system not all BP fields are authorizations relevant by default. Hence, first we must make all identified fields (Both MDG and S4 managed fields) as authorization relevant.  

Steps:

  • Go to BUCN transaction
  • Click on “New Entries”
  • Enter the field group IDs identified in earlier
  • Click on save
  • Once you click on save system to prompt to create a transport to capture these changes. We need

to move this transport (along with the role changes) across the landscape to reflect the changes

 

 

Adjusting Role Authorizations:

The first line of security when working with transaction code BP is at BP role type using B_BUPA_RLT authorization object (example: Customer, Supplier etc.). Then comes the field level security restrictions using authorization object B_BUPA_FDG. This is where you will enter the field groups which should be editable for this role.

 

 

Conclusion:

All these configurations and restrictions only work with transaction code BP but not with the Fiori Apps. Hence, only assign transaction code BP to the role and adjust the B_BUPA_RLT object as needed to provide access to required BP role type (example: Customer, Supplier). Then using authorization object B_BUPA_FDG we can restrict the role with display/change access to required fields. We must restrict all the MDG managed fields in S4 roles to display access only otherwise, the role gives access to fields which would bypass any MDG workflows. 

 

Security   SAP HANA   SAP Master Data Governance   SAP S/4HANA business partner

entry.title: Benefit From SAP Master Data Governance on SAP S/4HANA 2023 Feature Pack Stack 03
entry.content:
To complete the blog series about innovations in SAP Master Data Governance (MDG) coming in SAP S/4HANA 2023 (Initial Stack I Feature Pack Stack 01 I Feature Pack Stack 02), I'd now like to share delta information about the key MDG features coming with Feature Pack Stack 03.

Enabling field extensibility in customer and supplier views (cloud-ready mode)

To increase the effectiveness in master data governance of business-partner data in cloud-ready mode, we have enabled the following field extensibility capabilities: 

  • Apply field extensibility (custom fields) not only in the business-partner core view (BUT000), but also in customer and supplier views.
  • Extend fields in the following views:
    • Customer core view (KNA1)
    • Customer company code view (KNB1)
    • Customer sales area core view (KNVV)
    • Supplier core view (LFA1)
    • Supplier company code view (LFB1)
    • Supplier purchasing org view (LFM1)

Field extensibility in supplier view (cloud-ready mode)

Assignment of data controllers to a business partner in the classic mode of central governance

It is now possible to manually assign one or more data controllers to a business partner and set the "Invalid Assignment Status" for existing data controllers. Additionally, the system can immediately derive data controllers when the corresponding organizational units are maintained.

Setting the "Invalid Assignment Status" for existing data controllers

Enhanced validation of changes in financial data 

To avoid errors in the governance of financial data, checks for the most business-critical attributes can be made with remote function calls to target systems to make sure that proposed changes in MDG are validated before change request activation.

Defining target systems for remote validation and display of validation results in MDG processing

Gen AI-based assisted change for custom objects and summary of mass changes*

To further increase the effectiveness through AI in central governance​, we have enabled AI-assisted changes for reuse entities in custom objects and the AI-based summary of change requests with multiple objects (mass changes).

AI-assisted change and AI-based summary of changes

(* Please note that these Gen AI-based features are only available with SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud Edition)

See also the presentation outlining the MDG delta content coming with SAP S/4HANA 2023 FPS03.

To get the full picture of planned innovations in SAP Master Data Governance across the entire MDG solution portfolio, see the SAP Roadmap Explorer.

To stay up to date, simply follow the SAP Community Topic Page for SAP Master Data Governance and join the Q&A and discussion forum.

entry.title: What's New in SAP Master Data Governance, cloud edition 2502?
entry.content:
SAP Master Data Governance, cloud edition is a software-as-a-service (Saas) solution on SAP Business Technology Platform (SAP BTP) that is used to govern core attributes of business partner data (more domains planned). For details, see also the SAP Master Data Governance, cloud edition overview and deep-dive presentations.

What's New?

Continuing the blog series about innovations in SAP Master Data Governance, cloud edition, I'd like to provide you with details on the latest innovations with SAP Master Data Governance, cloud edition 2502. 

General Remark

As pointed out in the previous info blog about release 2411, several apps were deprecated and have now been deleted and are no longer available on the SAP Fiori launchpad. For a list of all affected apps, please refer to Deleted Apps.

Updates in Data Quality Management

Check for process attachments enabled: You can now use validation rules to check if a master data governance process has an attachment.

Updates in Central Governance

Configuration of process priorities and reasons enabled: You can configure your own process priorities and reasons using the Custom Business Configurations app. You can configure these details in the process information along with the due date.

Additional Configuration Updates

  • Configure process templates:  As of release 2505, the process templates that are marked as default and that are delivered on the SAP Templates tab in the Configure Process Templates app will no longer have an entry in the column BTP Step Workflow. Therefore, no step workflow will be initiated if you still use default SAP templates. You can follow the instructions to copy the provided SAP templates to custom templates. For more information, see Configure Process Templates.
  • Mandatory configuration of mail destination: As of release 2505, it is mandatory to configure a workflow capability mail destination if you want to use the predefined workflow definitions to send notification mails to users. Therefore, make sure to configure a mail destination now to avoid outages from 2505. 

For a complete overview of all updates, including information on deleted apps, including mandatory actions for you, see the latest What's New Viewer - SAP Master Data Governance, Cloud Edition.

To stay on track, simply follow the SAP Community Topic Page for SAP Master Data Governance, read the MDG-related blogs, and join the  Q&A forum.

Best,

Markus

entry.title: Master Data replication using IDOC-ALE - No consistency check in target system
entry.content:
For example, ALE project replication (transaction CJAL) using FM BAPI_PROJECT_SAVEREPLICA. First all necessary tables and table entries will be selected. At the end FM ALE_PROJECT_POST will be called:

Within FM ALE_PROJECT_POST modify statement is called on tables in the target system:

 

 

 

  MODIFY PROJ FROM TABLE PROJ_UP

  MODIFY PRPS FROM TABLE PRPS_UP.

  MODIFY PRHI FROM TABLE PRHI_UP.

  MODIFY JSTO FROM TABLE JSTO_UP.

  MODIFY JEST FROM TABLE JEST_UP.

 

 

 

So, this can lead to inconsistencies if source and target system are not fully in sync in terms of customizing and master data.

entry.title: Mass Update of Max Stock Level from Excel File Using MM46 in SAP S/4HANA Retail
entry.content:
In this case, we need to update the Max Stock Level (MABST) in the MARC table of SAP S/4HANA Retail using transaction MM46. To achieve this, we will prepare an Excel file with the required data and import it into SAP. Below are the steps to perform this update efficiently.


Step 1: Identify the Tables and Fields to Update

For this case, we need to update:

  • Table: MARC (Plant Data for Material)
  • Field: MABST (Max Stock Level)

Step 2: Prepare an Excel File (.XLSX)

Create an Excel file with three columns:

  • Material (MATNR)
  • Plant (WERKS)
  • Max Stock Level (MABST)

Important: The first row should contain the technical field names to match the SAP system requirements. (See image below for reference).

Step 3: Execute Transaction MM46

  • Open SAP GUI and run Transaction MM46.
  • Select the table (MARC) and the fields that need to be updated.

Step 4: Import the Excel File

  • Click on the "Import" button.
  • Select the prepared Excel file (.XLSX).
  • Ensure the system correctly maps the fields.

Step 5: Execute the Update

  • Confirm the settings to ensure the upload includes the header line (first row with technical field names).
  • Click on the "Execute" button.

Step 6: Preview Imported Data from Excel

  • Observe the uploaded data to ensure all fields are correctly populated.
  • Click on the "Execute" button.

Step 7: Confirm Imported Data on the Standard Screen

  • Observe the imported data to ensure accuracy.
  • Click on the "Test" button to validate the entries before finalizing the update.

Step 8: Review Results

  • Observe the results of the mass update.
  • Check the log for any errors or successful updates to ensure the process was completed correctly.

Conclusion

Using MM46 simplifies the mass update of material master data, saving time and ensuring data accuracy. This method is especially useful in SAP S/4HANA Retail, where frequent stock level adjustments are required.

entry.title: Value Mapping in SAP Master Data governance MDG-M
entry.content:
Introduction:

In SAP, value mapping refers to the process of mapping and transforming values from one system or set of values to another within the context of master data. This is particularly important when you are integrating SAP MDG with other systems or consolidating data from multiple sources.

In this example, we will see how a value mapping can be configured in SAP MDG with respect to Material master field – Division (MARA-SPART)

Let us consider that we have a source system (MDG Hub) and material master in the source system gets replicated via IDOC to transactional SAP system. As per the requirement, the Division value 30 in the source system needs to be converted to value 35 when data gets syndicated out to the target system. 

Details:

Step 1: Identify the Global Data type for the field SPART. For this you can go to below path

MDGIMG – Central governance for Material - Maintain Fields for IDOC Value Mapping.

As given in the below screenshot, the global data type for field SPART is MDGCO_DIVISION_CODE

Step 2: Maintain Value Mapping for the global data type. Go to path

MDGIMG – Data Replication settings – Value Mapping – Maintain Value mapping

Select the Navigation button and start assigning the ‘Assign Code list’ and values

In this ‘Assign code list’ Overview screen – add a list ID/mapping ID for the list of values for which you needed the conversion to happen.

Assign the list of values in the ‘Define Value Mapping’ that needs to be converted. Internal Code value is the value that will be sent by source system and External code value is the value that will be received by the target system.

In this example, I have added only one entry as Division Code 30 from MDG needs to be converted to Code 35 in the transactional SAP system.

Step 3: Now go to the below path

MDGIMG – Data Replication settings – Value Mapping – Assign Code Lists to Elements and Systems

Add a new entry by updating the Global Data type, Business system (target system), list ID, List agency id and version id

(Note the Global Data type, List ID, List Agency ID and version ID to the be the same as added in the previous screen)

Step 4:

Now update/replicate a material with Division '30' from MDG HUB and you can see that the material gets replicated out with '35' for the business system configured in the value mapping settings.

 

Conclusion:

Thus, the MDG value mapping configuration helps us to integrate the MDG system with other downstream/upstream systems by mapping and transforming values as per downstream/upstream requirements

entry.title: G2 Leadership for Master Data Management: Our Continued Show of Excellence
entry.content:
In the dynamic world of enterprise data management, achieving excellence based on reviews and rating from our customers is truly a milestone worth celebrating. We are thrilled to announce that we have been recognized as a spring 2025 leader in Master Data Management (MDM) by G2, the world's leading business solutions review platform. We believe the continuous recognition is a testament to our commitment to innovation, customer satisfaction, and continuous improvement.

Customer-Centric Approach

At the heart of our success is our customer-centric approach. We believe that our customers' feedback and insights are invaluable in shaping our products and services. By actively listening to their needs and addressing their pain points, we have been able to deliver solutions that truly make a difference. The positive reviews and high satisfaction ratings on G2 are a direct reflection of our commitment to putting our customers first.  Learn how our Customer Influence programs allow you to influence and adopt SAP innovations throughout the product lifecycle.

Innovation and Adaptability

In a rapidly evolving technological landscape, innovation and adaptability are key. Our team of experts continually explores new trends and technologies, ensuring that our MDM solutions remain at the forefront of the industry. Whether it's leveraging GenAI for automation and efficiency in master data governance or implementing analytics for better data quality management or MDM processes, we are always striving to stay ahead of the curve.  See what’s new in SAP Master Data Governance on SAP S/4HANA and cloud edition.

Looking Ahead

While we celebrate this milestone, we remain focused on the future. We are committed to building on this success and continuing to deliver innovative, high-quality MDM solutions that meet the evolving needs of our customers.  To view what is planned and coming next, check out the SAP Roadmap Explorer.

We are grateful to G2 for this recognition and to our customers for their trust and support. Thank you for being a part of our journey. Together, we will continue to redefine the future of Master Data Management.

entry.title: The Role of SAP Master Data Governance within the SAP Business Suite Strategy
entry.content:
In today’s data-driven business landscape, organizations struggle with data they do not trust, affecting their ability to innovate and harness the full potential of data and AI. A recent global survey highlighted that 55% of business and technology leaders cite poor data quality as their biggest challenge, with nearly half also pointing to the difficulties in harmonizing data across ecosystems as a major barrier to innovation. Data-oriented organizations, however, are found to be four times more likely to succeed compared to those in early data management maturity stages.

The Right Data Foundation

Business users require real-time, trusted, and contextually rich data for analytics and planning needs. SAP believes this necessitates seamless integration between all data platforms and business applications, underpinned by a consistent domain data model. SAP’s not only ensures data product consistency but also simplifies master data integration, providing a common language across the entire application landscape to ensure seamless, end-to-end business process execution.  In addition, with the rapid growth in the realm and possibilities of AI, this also requires organizations to first have the right data foundation.  And, as we know, the most important data in that foundation is your business-critical master data.

SAP Business Suite

SAP recently unveiled its new vision to integrate applications, data, and AI under the umbrella of the SAP Business Suite. This suite is not just a collection of solutions, but a comprehensive transformation engine designed to foster continuous innovation and improvement.

Here is how the SAP Business Suite works and how SAP Master Data Governance plays a role:

Unparalleled Applications (including integration and governance):

SAP’s business applications and Business Technology Platform (BTP) are tightly integrated, ensuring seamless, end-to-end business process execution and not just a set of isolated applications. Accordingly, SAP MDG is designed to offer deep integration within SAP applications rather than functioning merely as an adjacent tool. Of course, SAP MDG can be a master data management solution for any heterogeneous application landscape, but in the context of SAP applications, we can offer much more integration. We have shown this with scenarios embedded into SAP S/4HANA, or with federated SAP MDG deployments across an application landscape.  SAP Master Data Governance also helps to ensure that every action taken within these applications – as well as other points of entry - generates trusted, business-critical master data at its source.  SAP Master Data Governance ensures replication of high-quality master data across the suite to maintain data accuracy, consistency, and integrity.

Unmatched Data (along with data centralization and enrichment):

We then centralize, harmonize, and enrich master, transactional, 3rd party and other types & sources of data in SAP Business Data Cloud. It doesn’t matter where it’s generated, SAP or non-SAP systems, we unify it into a single source of truth. Contextualized, reliable, and accessible, this data becomes the fuel for advanced 360-degree or AI-driven insights.  SAP Master Data Governance supports this 360-degree or unified version of the truth, though master data duplication checks within the master data creation and consolidation processes. By creating a single, authoritative record (or “best record”), SAP MDG eliminates duplicate data entries and inconsistencies. 

Unrivaled AI (with a virtuous cycle of innovation):

While much of SAP MDG’s focus for AI is on automation and efficiency (e.g. GenAI for assisted master data changes); SAP Business AI goes beyond basic automation. SAP Business AI and Joule allow for Business-AI processes that are embedded directly into core operations, optimizing and automating repetitive processes in real-time, boosting productivity and efficiency. Through Joule, our AI copilot, employees can orchestrate intelligent agents to collaborate across functions. This breaks down silos, driving real-time, cross-enterprise optimization. Where others may deploy AI in pockets, SAP weaves it throughout the organization, unlocking value and resilience at scale. And as AI refines processes, they generate richer data that fuels even smarter decisions - creating that virtuous cycle of innovation that no one else can match.

SAP Business Data Cloud

The SAP Business Data Cloud (BDC) unifies and governs data from various sources, bridging data silos and providing a trusted and harmonized data foundation, empowering IT and business leaders with full business context to drive more impactful decisions.  SAP BDC is SAP’s unified data platform.  SAP MDG plugs into this platform by delivering high quality, master data across the SAP Business Suite - maintaining business-critical master data consistency, accuracy, and integrity. Business Data Cloud helps businesses unleash transformative new insights with prebuilt analytical applications and curated SAP data products.  And it provides the trusted data foundation to deliver the most reliable AI in our industry.

Data products are the building blocks for intelligent applications.  They are purpose built by line of business experts to help customers get the most out of their data.  And they solve the difficult task of bringing all their SAP data together in a single data platform while maintaining the meaning of that data and simplifying data management. SAP’s pre-built, fully managed data products will provide a 360-degree business view of a customer’s most critical business processes.

These curated data products maintain the original business context and semantics and align to that highly optimized and unified one domain model, the quality of those core master data attributes is managed with SAP MDG. Data products are included in the Business Data Cloud catalog making them easy to discover, use, and extend.  These data products are also consumed by BDC Insight Apps, which are pre-built analytical applications tailored to line of business analytics - such as People, Customer, or Supply Chain analytics – supporting 360-degree insights. In the future, SAP Master Data Governance can further contribute to these data products with additional master data metadata, like data quality scores, rule infractions, or whether a record is indeed the best record.

Conclusion

SAP’s Business Suite strategy, with SAP Master Data Governance supporting business-critical master data quality, represents a holistic approach to data management and innovation. By seamlessly integrating applications, data, and AI, SAP empowers businesses to trust their data, make smarter decisions, and drive continuous improvement. This approach underscores SAP’s commitment to creating a virtuous cycle of innovation, setting the standard for what organizations can achieve with a robust data foundation.

Discover how to get more complete, accurate, and compliant enterprise data with a modern master data management (MDM) system like SAP Master Data Governance. Explore what makes up an MDM system and what its role is in data fabric and AI initiatives.

  • Read the guide: https://www.sap.com/documents/2024/08/8aff13da-d17e-0010-bca6-c68f7e60039b.html
  • Listen to the AI-generated podcast: https://letstalkdatapodcast.podbean.com/e/the-evolving-role-of-mdm-in-modern-data-management/

entry.title: Welcome to Season 9 of SAP Let's Talk Data: Building Trust in the Data-Driven World
entry.content:
Hello, data enthusiasts and business leaders! We're thrilled to announce the kick-off of Season 9 of the SAP Let's Talk Data podcast series. This season, we're diving deep into the real challenges of data today and how building trust in data can transform your business.

Season 9 Video 

Why Trust in Data Matters

We live in a data-driven world where businesses are investing billions into AI, analytics, and automation. However, there’s a significant hurdle—many companies still don’t trust their data. Without this trust, AI can’t deliver, automation stalls, and digital transformation never reaches its full potential.

That’s why we created SAP Let’s Talk Data—the podcast that tackles the real challenges of data today. Trusted, business-ready data isn’t just important; it’s the foundation for everything else. Trust in data doesn’t happen by accident. It’s built through strong governance, secure AI, and the ability to connect all your data in meaningful ways. When done right, trusted data empowers businesses to model scenarios, drive innovation, and unlock the full value of AI.

What’s in Store for Season 9?

This season is packed with insights, case studies, and practical tips from data practitioners and innovators. Here are some of the exciting episodes that are lined up:

  • 📌The Evolution and Impact of AI in eSports: How SAP’s BTP Keeps Team Liquid One Step Ahead - Discover how AI and analytics are transforming eSports, providing strategic insights and boosting performance.
  • 📌The Future of Enterprise AI starts with Knowledge Graphs, Powered by SAP HANA Cloud - Dive deep into what knowledge graphs are, how they transform data analysis, and the value they unlock for organizations already using HANA Cloud or considering it. 
  • 📌 Accelerate transformation with a focus on data management and modernization – Learn how data preparation and transformation can help companies reduce costs, accelerate time to value, and minimize risk during transformation projects.
  • 📌Transforming Supply Chain Management - Explore AI-powered search and optimization techniques that are revolutionizing logistics.
  • 📌SAP Business Data Cloud - Understand how contextualized, reliable, and accessible, this data becomes the fuel for advanced 360-degree or AI-driven insights. 
  • 📌Unlocking Business Data for AI-Powered Applications - Delve into the strategies for building next-gen, data-intensive apps that are context-aware and securely connected.

Join the Conversation

Welcome to SAP Let’s Talk Data, where we break down how businesses can go from data overload to data confidence—unlocking AI, smarter decision-making, and real transformation.  We’re excited to embark on this journey with you. Whether you’re a seasoned data professional or new to the field, there’s something for everyone in Season 9 of Let’s Talk Data. Stay tuned, and let’s build a future where every piece of data is trusted and reliable.

Subscribe Now!

Don’t miss out on our insightful discussions and expert opinions. Subscribe to SAP Let’s Talk Data on:

  • Spotify
  • Apple Podcasts
  • YouTube
  • And more…

New episodes are live now, so get ready to dive deep into the world of data. Let’s talk data!

Interested in more SAP podcasts? 

Check out the SAP BTPTalk series to keep up to data with what’s new in SAP Business Technology Platform.

entry.title: Incorporating GenAI into SAP Master Data Governance - Central Governance
entry.content:
Overview

The idea of AI capabilities integrated with SAP Master Data Governance is exciting with AI assisted features already delivered by SAP. The possibilities are endless and it is beautifully explained in the blog post by @Mark63 Thoughts About Generative AI in Master Data Governance. One of my key takeaway from the blog post is "the journey of AI integration in SAP Master Data Governance processes has only just begun." 
Simply put, we are in this journey as pioneers & explorers to improve global business processes; one solution at a time.

This got me into thinking and developing a simple use case of "Comprehensive summary of Master Data with key insights using GenAI" for central governance. The driving factor behind the idea was a simple "What if?" Let's dive a little deeper now.

Driving Factor

"What if there existed a unified platform to obtain a thorough overview of master data, featuring essential insights on transactional activities and data quality?" The motivation is to allow users to have an high level overview of master data with a single click of a button.

Solution

AI Summarization of the Master Data elements with a simple button on the SAP MDG Central Governance search screen. 

Considerations

Data Protection: The solution was developed in a sandbox system utilizing dummy data.
LLM's data protection and guidelines should be considered in building solutions around GenAI that includes Data Minimization, Data Isolation and access control.

Conclusion

By leveraging Generative AI, we can create a unified platform that provides users with a comprehensive overview of master data, complete with critical insights into transactional activities and data quality, all at the click of a button. This innovative approach not only streamlines governance processes but also empowers decision-makers with the information they need to drive business success.

As we continue to explore and pioneer this journey, it is essential to remain vigilant about data protection and adhere to best practices in data management. By prioritizing data minimization, isolation, and access control, we can ensure that our solutions are not only effective but also secure. The future of AI in SAP Master Data Governance is bright, and with each step we take, we are laying the groundwork for a more efficient and insightful governance landscape.

entry.title: What's New in SAP Master Data Governance, cloud edition 2505?
entry.content:
SAP Master Data Governance, cloud edition is an SaaS solution on SAP Business Technology Platform (SAP BTP) that is used to govern core attributes of business partner data (more domains planned). Companies can use it to kickstart a master data management initiative at low entry barriers. For details, see also the SAP Master Data Governance, cloud edition overview and deep-dive presentations.

What's New?

Continuing the blog series about innovations in SAP Master Data Governance, cloud edition, I'd like to provide you with details on the latest innovations with SAP Master Data Governance, cloud edition 2505. New features come in the areas of data quality management and SOAP replication of business partner.​

Data Quality Management

New features in the Validation Rules for Business Partners app​ include:

  • Delete the validation rules' dependencies to other objects (for example, simulations, dimensions, or data quality evaluation runs) when deleting rules​
  • Disable several validation rules at once​
  • Filter for enabled usages, disabled usages and usages in general​

SOAP Replication

The enhanced SOAP replication of business partners includes:

  • ​Replication of business partners with their relationships​
  • Selective replication of specific business partner roles​
  • Automatic retriggering of business partner relationship messages

Workflow Configuration

Note: As of release 2505, you must configure a mail destination to send notifications. To do this, create a mail destination in your subaccount, as described in Configure Workflow Capability Mail Destination.

For a complete overview of all updates, see the latest What's New Viewer - SAP Master Data Governance, Cloud Edition.

To stay on track, simply follow the SAP Community Topic Page for SAP Master Data Governance, read the MDG-related blogs, and join the  Q&A forum.

 

 

Best,

Markus

​

entry.title: Improve BP master data with SAP MDG DQM to reduce superfluous costs in invoicing processes
entry.content:
Introduction:

In invoicing processes with suppliers and customers, bank account information such as account number and IBAN play an important role. If this information is not correctly maintained in the business partner master data, costs arise from faulty bank transactions, and business partner relationships may also be strained due to delayed payment processes.

With the help of SAP MDG DQM validations and derivations, such situations can be avoided. A fully automatic reconciliation between account numbers and IBAN can be carried out. Initially, erroneous data records are detected through a DQM validation rule and a DQM evaluation run. Subsequently, these data records can be automatically corrected via an MDG mass process.

Background:

Depending on the configuration and history of the SAP S/4HANA system, account information and IBAN numbers are stored in different database tables. Account numbers and other details are found in the BUT0BK table. Associated IBAN numbers are stored in the TIBAN table. More detailed information on this is well described in the SAP Community Blog SAP S/4HANA Business Partner: Handling of IBAN with CVI.

When new business partners are created using SAP S/4HANA and/or SAP MDG, the information is correctly written into the tables, and no action is required. However, due to the migration of legacy data, interfaces, and data transfers, it can happen that the IBAN numbers, which contain the account number, do not match the dedicated account numbers in the BUT0BK table. In payment transactions, incorrect or improperly formatted account numbers are then used, and bank transactions can fail.

With the help of the SAP MDG DQM validation rule explained here, such erroneous BUT0BK entries are detected. The DQM rule will use a standard function module via BRF+ to calculate the correct bank account numbers from the IBAN numbers. A DQM evaluation run will iterate over all BUT0BK entries and identify erroneous records according to the rule. The user can then send these erroneous records to a mass process. This will automatically correct the account number in BUT0BK through a derivation step. Here, too, the SAP standard function module for calculation is reused.

DQM Validation Rule

The validation rule is created using the SAP MDG app "Validations Rules for Business Partners." The base table is the table BUT0BK, and the field being checked is BUT0BK-BANKN.

The following screenshot shows the rule in the app:

The scope of the rule defines which records are checked. It is important that only records with an IBAN in the bank details are checked. Therefore, the scope expression includes a BRF+ artifact to read the IBAN from TIBAN using the function module READ_IBAN_EXT through the parameters of the BUT0BK table. If an entry/IBAN is found, the record can be validated and is "in scope."

The following screenshot shows this scope expression:

The condition expression itself compares the value from BUT0BK-BANKN with the result of the function module CONVERT_IBAN_2_BANK_ACCOUNT. If the values are different, it means that there is an error for this data record. The following screenshot shows the condition expression.

 

 

 

DQM Derivation Scenario / Rule

 

The derivation rule is very similar to the validation rule and uses the same function blocks. Instead of detecting an error, a derivation can also write or correct the value.

In this case, an extra derivation scenario was defined for this demo in the SAP MDG DQM app "Define Derivation Scenario for Business Partners." The name is, for example, "Correct Bank Account Numbers." The base table is BUT0BK, as in this case the BANKN field of this table is corrected. The scenario only requires one rule at the field level. Additional rules are not necessary.

As with the validation rule, the scenario scope can also act on the presence of an IBAN for the bank account number. This ensures that only relevant records are processed in the derivation scenario.

The rule on the BANKN field is relatively simple to define: There are no condition fields, and only the BANKN field is defined as the result field. The screenshot shows the rule in the app "Define Derivation Scenario for Business Partners."

 

The decision table CALC_BANKN_FLD_DT generated by the SAP MDG framework also uses the SAP standard function modules to calculate the correct value for the bank account number via the IBAN. The following screenshot shows the details:

 

All DQM artifacts must be approved and activated after implementation. Additionally, the rule itself must be set to the status "Execution – YES".

Running the scenarios

 Execute Evaluation Run

If no automatic execution of the evaluation run is scheduled, it can be started via the SAP MDG app "Evaluate Data Quality."

 

 

Review of the evaluation run

With the app "Evaluation Results for Business Partners," the result can be examined in detail. By applying a filter to the rule, the erroneous data sets can be isolated and viewed. In the following screenshot, you can see that 7 business partners do not comply with the rule:

 

Remediation process with Mass Processing

To initiate a remediation process for one or more datasets, use the "Process" functionality directly from the "Evaluation Results for Business Partners" app.

In the following screenshot, 2 datasets are placed into a mass process.

 

In the following pop-up screen, the process template to be executed can be selected.

Info: This popup is only available in Cloud Ready Mode. In classic mode, the standard template is always used.

During the process, the derivation scenario is executed. The following screenshot shows the process after the derivation rule. It can be seen that the two incorrect bank accounts in BUT0BK have been corrected.

It is also apparent that a business partner has obviously defined multiple bank accounts, and one of them was already correct. Therefore, it was not overwritten.

Rerun the evaluation process.

If the evaluation run is triggered again, the data quality will have improved because the two corrected data sets will no longer be recognized as errors.

Compare the result with point 1: only 5 bank accounts are still incorrect.

Hope this MDG scenarios makes sense for you and please give feedback. In case of questions don’t hesitate to add them to this blog

Best Regards

Steffen

SAP Master Data Governance SAP Data Quality Management

entry.title: SAP Master Data Governance - Roadmap Session at SAP Sapphire 2025
entry.content:
I recently discussed the topic of master data management in various sessions at Sapphire 2025, Orlando. For example, I discussed how to get more complete, accurate, and compliant enterprise data with a modern master data management system and what is MDM's role in data fabric, data product, and AI initiatives.

Fully packed session at Sapphire 2025

I also outlined  our plans for the SAP Master Data Governance (MDG) solution portfolio in a roadmap session:

Session title

The MDG roadmap session again saw a large crowd of attendees at this year's Sapphire and our growth and development plans for the MDG portfolio resonated well with the audience. But I know that not everybody can travel to Orlando, I hence would like to share the news with everybody who couldn't join. (The slides below are the ones that I used in the Sapphire roadmap session.)

Please note that the roadmap disclaimer is indicating that future items are subject to change applies.

Solution Introduction

To get started, let me very briefly explain what SAP Master Data Governance (MDG) is, and which topics it addresses.

SAP Master Data Governance at a glance

MDG is an application to manage master data, it provides preconfigured, domain-specific master data governance to monitor, find and correct data quality issues. You can either centrally create, change, and distribute, or you can consolidate master data coming from different systems in your entire enterprise landscape.

MDG is one application for all master data. It is not only for SAP master data. It does come with a lot of out-of-the-box, domain-specific capabilities that are, of course, based on SAP’s data models and business logic. But it is also a platform that is used by many customers to build master data governance processes on extended data models and completely custom-defined master data domains.

SAP Master Data Governance key capabilities

 From our customers, we understand that the purpose of master data management is to improve the quality of master data and to establish a corporate-wide understanding of it, enabling them to run and optimize their business based on a trusted master data foundation.

As you probably know, companies take different approaches to MDM. For example, some allow for de-central ownership of master data, and create a common understanding by using master data consolidation to create key mapping between detected duplicates and to create a golden record. Others prefer central ownership of master data and distribute master data that is always created in high quality. Some companies decide to take a de-central approach for some domains, like customer master data, and a central approach for other domains, for example, when introducing new products. On top of that, many companies constantly monitor how the quality of master data evolves. And then they react if they find issues.

MDG supports all these approaches and also all combinations of these approaches in a very integrated and organized way, and this is very much appreciated by our customers. This allows you to combine approaches as required to cover all use cases and all implementation styles, for a complete enterprise master data management program with just one solution: SAP MDG.

Strategy and Vision

Our strategy and vision for MDG have been very consistent for years, and we are successfully executing this vision. Our MDG product strategy is not an isolated strategy just for MDG - it is embedded into SAP’s broader strategy and vision, which is outlined in this slide.

SAP vision bringing together applications, data, and AI

Through SAP’s unparalleled applications, our end-to-end business processes connect all parts of an organization. This ensures processes are smooth, consistent, and ready for AI-driven improvements.

SAP can also provide unmatched data, because by harmonizing information from SAP and non-SAP sources into one unified Business Data Cloud, we give AI agents a 360-degree perspective, and everything is instantly ‘understood’ in its business context.

When you then bring the right data to specialized AI agents orchestrated by SAP Joule, you unlock continuous optimization across lines of business. Instead of isolated automation, you get an interconnected system that learns, adapts, and improves at scale. We think that this is the best approach to AI.

This synergy between applications, data, and AI is the driving force behind the SAP Business Suite. 

SAP MDG supporting the new era of enterprise management

The graphic above illustrates how MDG will support SAP’s broader vision of bringing together applications, data, and AI. Let me start from the bottom:

As pointed out before, SAP offers a suite of applications with end-to-end scenarios – and not just isolated applications. Accordingly, we have built MDG not just as a solution “next to” applications. Of course, MDG can be an MDM solution for any heterogeneous application landscape. But in the context of SAP applications, we can offer much more integration. We have shown this with scenarios embedded into SAP S/4HANA, or with federated MDG deployments across an application landscape, or with integrated scenarios across SAP Ariba Supplier and Lifecycle Performance and MDG.

When we look at SAP Business Data Cloud (BDC), this provides semantically rich data from various data sources, and master data often is the most critical data asset. MDG curates this master data towards a trustful and high-quality treasure, really unlocking the value of other business data, or also feeding into 360 views via Intelligent Apps as well as data products within BDC.

When it comes to Artificial Intelligence and MDG there are two key aspects: on the one hand MDG leverages AI technology for process automation to speed up MDG processing. But more importantly, the trusted high-quality master data in MDG, provided to all applications and to SAP BDC, truly enables SAP Business AI across all SAP standard and custom-built AI scenarios and agents.

SAP Master Data Governance in SAP Business Suite

The SAP Business Suite represents the culmination of SAP’s overall vision for the future of enterprise management. It combines core ERP and Line of Business applications, and it is fueled by business data and meaningful AI. It is a comprehensive, integrated set of solutions designed to seamlessly connect and optimize every function across your enterprise. This solution architecture, as shown in the graphic above, ensures that all parts of your business operate in sync, unlocking agility, efficiency, and innovation.

In this context, you may ask yourself where SAP MDG fits in: SAP MDG is technically built on the SAP Business Technology Platform and commercially part of the BTP. And it is truly the enabler of the SAP Business Suite’s applications and of SAP Business Data Cloud by providing trusted and high-quality master data for flawless end-to-end business processes, trustful insights, and reliable automation through Business AI.

Investment drivers for SAP Master Data GovernanceHow does this translate into the strategic investments that we are planning for SAP MDG’s roadmap? Our roadmap for MDG is driven by the integrated vision and value proposition of the SAP Business Suite, and by customer needs and master data management market trends that arise in this context.

With the benefits of the SAP Business Suite at hand, SAP can provide much more value to our customers than just any MDM tool provider, because we understand how master data is used in business contexts. Leveraging this understanding, we create benefits for our customers. We can provide master data management capabilities that truly support all domains, all industries, and all approaches, embedded into the business. We have proven this with MDG, and we will continue to deliver on this unique promise. 

In addition, we see certain trends in the market, which will be laid out in in more detail further below. But let's start with highlighting how interrelated these trends are.

For example, new sources for trusted data in the cloud, or data sharing in business networks in the cloud will allow for more automation in keeping your master data records up to date.

Or take the fact that digitization or the application of artificial intelligence demands for higher volumes and better quality of master data, and therefore needs more automation in master data management.

As we know, the market for business application software is moving towards modular but integrated applications and towards the cloud. For most companies, this move to the cloud is not one single step. To facilitate a step-by-step journey, modularization is a key enabler that allows to also move MDM capabilities to the cloud step-by-step, as required by the applications.

Cloud as strategy driver

Let’s come to the first trend: the cloud. When business applications are moving to the cloud, the master data itself needs to be provided there. Of course, this is possible with MDG today. But in addition, we will continue to provide cloud-based master data integration services on the SAP Business Technology Platform. We will also build out data quality services as microservices in the cloud. We currently offer Address-Validation-as-a-Service against always up-to-date address directories, in the cloud.

I already mentioned that a stepwise move of business applications to the cloud demands for a modular approach to MDM. We are addressing this need with federation of MDG. This will, by the way, also help to meet the increasingly local compliance regulations. Modularization and cloud consumption will also enable our customers to get to a positive return on investment much faster and to grow their enterprise MDM program exactly in the pace needed for their strategic business initiatives.

Strategy drivers: digitization and AI

I think we all agree that master data is the key resource of any digital transformation and AI initiative. We will enhance MDG to help companies to become more intelligent, more agile, and to always process data compliantly.

Digitization and AI will demand for modular, specialized business applications, and we will help to provide harmonized, high-quality master data to these applications to enable end-to-end processes for intelligent enterprises. The key drivers we are focusing on in MDG are automation enablement, efficiency, and master data quality management. 

In the modular application landscape of the future, it will be a challenge to provide frictionless digital processes. SAP’s Business Technology Platform will be the foundation to achieve this. SAP Business Data Cloud for SAP and non-SAP integration will enable this. And this will provide our customers with a very high return on their investment into master data quality, because SAP’s common data foundation will allow to then broadly apply artificial intelligence as well as analytical scenarios to all data, and this is then powered by high-quality master data provided by MDG. This means that every investment in enhancing master data with MDG will yield significant returns in all your data-driven scenarios on top of SAP BTP and BDC. 

We also continue to see clear proof of this interrelation of digitization and investments into master data management, as many of the current SAP S/4HANA transformation programs at our customers use MDG to prepare this fundamental move for their company.

Strategy driver: automation

As pointed out before, digitization and AI are key drivers for automation in MDM. We will leverage SAP’s deep knowledge in business applications, analytics, and business networks to reduce the need for manual tasks in achieving high master data quality. 

We leverage third-party data providers to drive automation in master data creation. We provide ways to predict master data attribute values from an application context, and we continue to use more artificial intelligence to support master data quality tasks. This will help to reduce the human effort in MDM and to avoid errors created by humans, and to avoid the effort it takes to correct these human errors.

This kind of automation will need an agile, rapidly-scaling MDM solution that can be extended fast, scales quickly, and easily integrates with new systems, new business processes and new data types. We think that in the long run, a modular approach to MDM might be more effective to meet this agility, more effective than a monolithic approach.

 

Strategy driver: modularization

 

Let’s now focus on federation/modularization. I have pointed out how a more modular application landscape requires a modular approach to MDM, and what other benefits in agility, speed, efficiency, and TCO we expect from that approach. Therefore, we provide this additional deployment option for MDG. This can be an option for companies that plan to balance central and decentral MDG processes instead of using a fully centrally managed MDG approach. This can for example be an alternative for very heterogeneous companies running very differently set up business processes and application systems in their landscape, and, for example, also multiple differently configured SAP S/4HANA systems. 

We believe in providing choices and non-disruptive journeys for our customers. This is why this additional deployment option is not only for new customers, but it can also be used by existing customers by adding to their current implementation and safeguarding their investments into MDG.

As of today, most companies are using one single MDG system to centrally manage the master data for the complete enterprise. Of course, they can continue to do so. But for some companies, one single monolithic MDM system for the entire organization presents certain challenges already today. And as we discussed, this will even increase in the future.

The new approach with a federated MDG landscape will allow these companies to go for a more modular approach. We believe that we provide companies with a faster time to value, with increased flexibility that enables a broader MDM scope, and with a lower Total-Cost-of-Ownership. Federation allows companies to execute master data management as centrally as possible, but also as locally as needed by the diverse parts of the organization. They can really govern the data at the place where it is best understood. You can find further details in the blog post about the benefits of federation.

SAP Master Data Governance product versions

SAP offers options for consuming SAP Master Data Governance across the cloud and on premise, so companies can decide which deployment approach works best for them.

  • On the left-hand side, you see SAP MDG on SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition – which can also be deployed on premise. This version is typically used for multi-domain, centralized governance across complete enterprises. It has pre-delivered business content across various domains (for example, business partner, customer, supplier, material, financial data), and there are solution extensions from SAP Partners. This version comes with a very flexible framework to extend processes or create custom master data objects that even meet the very complex needs of the largest enterprises.
  • In the middle, there is SAP MDG on SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition. This is typically for organizations who are running SAP S/4HANA in the public cloud. This version currently focuses on business partner, customer, supplier, and product data. It is easy to consume and provides the processes for the very broad underlying S/4HANA data model.
  • And then, SAP Master Data Governance, cloud edition, shown on the right-hand side, is a software-as-a-service kick-start solution for the governance of core business partner data. 

We will continue to enhance all three versions of MDG. The strategy is for all versions of MDG to offer the same broad coverage of master data management processes across central governance, consolidation, data quality management and more. The two differences are: firstly, in the data model, which is either the very broad data model provided by SAP S/4HANA, or it is the core data model of SAP Business Technology Platform. The second difference is in how you can consume MDG, from a very easy to consume SaaS solution in the public cloud (on the right-hand side) to a robust private platform that supports even the most demanding customizations required by the world's largest companies (on the left-hand side).

Recent and Planned Innovations

I would now like to focus on some recent and planned innovations, and to explain how these relate to our product strategy. You may have already noticed the small graphic in the top right corner. It highlights which part of our strategy is addressed by each innovation.

Recent innovation: data provider integration

 

As mentioned earlier, digitization requires automation in MDM since lacking master data quality is a major barrier to innovation, to informed business decisions, and to the effective use of AI. We therefore invested into automation to help customers increase master data quality more efficiently with MDG. Automation in MDG always has two pillars. Pillar one is that leveraging trusted external data is much more efficient than typing it manually. And pillar two: we leverage technology – like AI – but also automated processes and rules-based automation.

The first recent innovation in this context is about automation with the help of trusted external data. We had already offered creation and enrichment of business partner data based on reference data from our partner Corporate Data Quality, who has access to more than 70 sources of trusted business partner data around the globe. Until recently, this was only possible in an interactive manner. We have now released a capability to add an automatic Reference Data Lookup step to MDG processes. This process step performs the search in the external data provider in the background and without user interaction. If this search finds a reference data record that is "good enough", it automatically takes over data, such as for example tax IDs and identification numbers and enriches the data in MDG. This further reduces the time users need to spend on master data management.

Recent innovation: generative AI for assisted changes and summary of changes

 Let's move on to two additional artificial intelligence scenarios that we have added recently.

  • The first one is “Summary of Changes”, which, for example, can help users who are approving master data changes. They get a natural language explanation of the requested changes.
  • The second scenario is “Assisted Change”. It allows users to change master data attributes using prompts in natural language. For example, people who are less trained or less experienced in master data management can communicate the intended change more easily to the system, and are then guided towards the right attributes in the data model that reflect their intended change.

We use Large Language Models for these capabilities, and customers can choose which LLM provider we should use. To achieve this, SAP has an abstraction layer, SAP’s AI foundation, which we leverage for our scenarios.

Planned innovation: integration with SAP Joule

Let's continue with the use of AI in MDG. The AI scenarios outlined earlier are directly embedded into MDG’s user interfaces. This way, they support users who already navigated into these UIs to work within MDG processes.

In addition, we have enabled MDG integration with SAP Joule, our generic copilot, which is always available for SAP users, regardless which process they are currently working in. Now, every business user can look up existing business partners in the system from their current work context. They just open the copilot in the side bar and start a chat in natural language, while SAP Joule guides them through a dialogue. If a user decides that changes to a business partner are needed, SAP Joule can take him or her to the right MDG user interface to carry out or trigger the changes.

Planned innovation: enhanced business partner governance in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

Now let's come to some planned innovations. Again, the graphic in the top-right corner shows how these relate to our vision. As you can see, this is related to modularization and the cloud.

Later this year, we plan to enhance the capabilities for the governance for business partner master data on SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition. On our way to leveraging cloud-ready mode in all MDG product versions, we will also use this mode in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition to have a common development base for the MDG key capabilities. Cloud-ready mode in MDG was already introduced in SAP Master Data Governance, cloud edition in 2021 and in SAP MDG on SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition in 2023.

This covers the processes for central governance – including inbound processing that triggers governance processes. It includes data provider integration with CDQ, as well as data quality management with validations and enrichment, and more.

For our customers on SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, this means they can introduce governance and control of the creation and change processes for business partner data, and they can increase effectiveness in the management of business partner data. As mentioned earlier, the focus now is on business partner data, further master data domains are planned for later – next in line is the product domain.

Planned innovation: processing business partner using SAP Joule

One more planned innovation that I would like to introduce also relates to AI. The recent innovation involving SAP Joule integration that I explained earlier was more about finding existing business partners or triggering changes by taking the user to the MDG user interface. We plan to expand this Joule dialog, so that the users can do even more without having to leave their work context.

With the planned innovation shown in the graphic above, business users can not only ask SAP Joule to search or display business partner data, but also use the AI copilot when it comes to changing or creating business partner data using natural language, without leaving their current tasks and without having to have any MDG expertise. They describe, in natural language, what master data changes they would like to initiate, and SAP Joule will guide them through a complete dialogue, and ultimately trigger the request for changes in the background. That way, every business user can seamlessly participate in master data processing, enhancing the effectiveness, speed, and automation of business partner governance. Instead of unstructured requests being sent to your master data team, who then has to enter these into the system, business users will now be supported by SAP Joule to provide structured input that only needs to be enriched and validated by the experts. And even those tasks can be largely automated by MDG through automatic derivations and validations. 

 Snapshot of MDG roadmap

 

Finally, here is an overview of all the innovations that we have planned for the next few years. All this information is also available in the SAP Roadmap Explorer. This slide reads from left to right, starting with recent innovations on the left-hand side and showing the planned innovations for 2025 and beyond. 

I know that this might look a bit of an eye chart, so I recommend taking a closer look at the Roadmap Explorer. For now, I have highlighted some of the most important planned innovations in a larger font:

Innovation highlights

When it comes to summarizing the innovation highlights, I have already mentioned the scenarios for AI that we already provided. We also provided innovations around data quality analytics in SAP Analytics Cloud, reference data processes and derivation scenarios.

With regards to the innovation highlights planned further up on the road, I already mentioned our plan to enable all relevant MDG processes for business partner data on SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Version. So far, we have offered that full functionality on SAP S/4HANA only for on-premise and private cloud deployments.

In addition, we intend to focus a lot on the product domain, which includes the cloud-ready mode architecture across all versions of MDG.

In parallel, we are working on further platform capabilities, like providing SAP Master Data Governance, cloud edition on SAP BTP also as Platform-as-a-Service (currently, it is offered as Software-as-a-Service) and providing the cloud-ready mode option also for custom-defined objects.

In addition, there are all the other planned innovations shown in the background of the graphic that you can check out in detail in the SAP Roadmap Explorer.

SAP Master Data Governance in a nutshell

To summarize, SAP Master Data Governance is the one solution for your entire enterprise master data management program. It is an application that provides preconfigured, domain-specific master data governance. At the same time, it is an open platform to extend and build, in order to manage your own master data domains for all SAP and non-SAP landscapes.

MDG is also a key enabler that will help you get ready for your future business transformations. Many things are already available today, but we also discussed all the innovations on our roadmap for MDG that follow our main themes of automation, and federation to enable our customers’ digital transformation and their path to the cloud. Our roadmap for MDG will focus on unlocking these additional benefits for our customers, while SAP’s Business Suite vision continues to allow us to do more than just provide a toolbox for master data management.

To stay on track with what's going on in SAP MDG, simply follow the SAP Community Topic Page for SAP Master Data Governance and join the Q&A and discussion forum.

Best,
Markus

entry.title: Reimagining SAP MDG Field Validations Low-Code Approach | UI Field Control Made Dynamic Yet Simple !
entry.content:
Overview

Working with SAP MDG (Master Data Governance) often means balancing two realities: robust governance and agile adaptability. One of the common we face during MDG implementation is managing field validations with user-friendly alerts.

Whether a field should be hidden, mandatory or optional often depends on multiple factors like CR type, entity, company code or user role etc. Traditionally, these validations are implemented via BRF+ expressions, Enhancements in feeder classes, Hard-coded logic in the UI layer/BAdIs.

The Problem: Code Dependency in Field Validation

MDG validations are crucial for maintaining clean and consistent master data. However, the standard methods come with limitations & most teams rely on:

  • Feeder class logic: Feeder class enhancements require ABAP expertise and testing cycles.
  • UI rule maintenance is scattered and often difficult to track.
  • BRF+ rules or hardcoded validations code: Every new business scenario (e.g. different behaviour based on company code or region) means new logic and testing.
  • No centralized view of how validations are controlled across the application.

- While these are functional, they’re rigid, developer-dependent, and non-scalable. This complexity makes it difficult for functional/ business teams to adapt validations quickly and every change creates a dependency on development teams reducing agility.

Challenges: Too Much Code, Too Little Agility
  • Hide/Show fields based on Role UI logic  is non-transparent.
  • Maintain field rules over time - Static logic -No visibility for business teams.
  • The key pain point: Every small validation change turns into a development cycle.

- But what if we could avoid coding and development cycle every time specially for simple level properties or validations, yet still provide fully dynamic, context-sensitive field behaviour.

Solution: Rule the Config-Driven Field Validation Framework [ All In One Place]

To address these challenges, a custom configuration table was designed to serve as a central validation engine covers easy level validations. Field behaviour across various MDG entities and scenarios was defined through this table eliminating the need for code changes every time.

- These rules are consumed at runtime ensuring the UI responds dynamically based on master data context.

- Validation Types : M = Mandatory, O = Optional, H = Hidden, R = Read Only

- This table is maintained via a simple maintenance view or SM30 transaction/T-Code assigned to TMG accessible to key users or functional consultants.

All this happens without modifying feeder classes or enhancing the UI every time.

Benefits of This Approach
  • No More Coding: New validation rules don’t require any ABAP changes at-least for simple validations.
  • Business Empowerment: Functional/Business teams can maintain rules via a user-friendly view.
  • Central Governance: One place to view and manage all field control rules along with by whom & when it’s added or changed.
  • Audit-friendly: clearly see why and when a rule applies.
  • No BRF+ overload: clean separation of decision logic.
  • Faster Change Cycles: No transports or regression testing required for every new validation rule.
  • Scalable to all MDG domains MDG – S,M,C (Supplier, Material, Customer)
Real Impact
  • After rollout: Reduced ~70% of validation-related change requests.
  • Built an enterprise-grade, reusable framework used across modules.
  • Delivered faster time-to-compliance for changing regulatory/market needs.
  • It's a shift from “write code to validate” ➝ to “configure to adapt”
How It Works: Plug-In Logic, Zero Enhancement for later changes
  1. Custom Table is maintained in SM30 or Z/Y T-code (or via custom UI).
  2. Lightweight enhancement logic is added once to retrieve rules based on runtime values.
  3. The UI behaviour adjusts: field becomes hidden, read-only mandatory or optional.
  4. No need to touch feeder classes again & ever.
You can even combine this with:
  • Workflow context (field is mandatory only in approval steps)
  • User or Role-level personalization (validation based on user group)
  • For multiple conditions can add different Sr. No conditions. E.g. Department is mandatory for Company Code =  ‘0001’  & '0005', So Can add two records with different Sr. No.
Requirement - For CR Type: ZCCT1P2: Create Cost Center with Hry. Assignments:
  1.    Business Area to be hidden.
  2.    Profit Center is mandatory.
  3.    Department is mandatory for Company Code =  ‘0001’
  4.    User Responsible is mandatory for cost center category = ‘%’.
Implementation

[ Fig. 1.0. Table Contents ]

  • ZCCT1P2: Create Cost Center with Hry. Assignments.
  • Step ‘0’ defines Requestor Level.
  • Tech Property  & Conditional Tech-Property stores technical attributes.
  • Table also contains audit columns to track changes.
  1. BAdI: USMD_ACC_FLD_PROP_CUST_DEP_SET
  • EI: ZFI_ES_MDG_FLD_PROP
  • BAdI Implementation: ZFI_MDG_FLD_PROP
  • Class: ZCL_FI_MDG_FLD_PROP
  • Method: IF_EX_USMD_ACC_FLD_PROP_CDS~MODIFY_FLD_PROP_ATTR
  METHOD if_ex_usmd_acc_fld_prop_cds~modify_fld_prop_attr.

    DATA:lr_model TYPE REF TO if_usmd_app_context.
    CALL METHOD cl_usmd_app_context=>get_context
      RECEIVING
        eo_context = lr_model.
    IF lr_model IS BOUND.
      CALL METHOD lr_model->get_attributes
        IMPORTING
          ev_crequest_type = DATA(lv_cr_type)
          ev_crequest_step = DATA(lv_cr_step).
    ENDIF.

    DATA: go_tab_descr   TYPE REF TO cl_abap_tabledescr,
          go_struc_descr TYPE REF TO cl_abap_structdescr,
          lt_components  TYPE abap_component_tab.
    DATA: name_range TYPE RANGE OF zfi_mdg_valt-condition_tech.

    "Pre-Exception Handling To Get Valid Fields For it_data As not-valid entry entered in Condition Property
    go_tab_descr ?= cl_abap_tabledescr=>describe_by_data( it_data ).
    CHECK sy-subrc = 0.
    go_struc_descr ?= go_tab_descr->get_table_line_type( ). "Get the structure of your internal table
    lt_components  = go_struc_descr->get_components( ).
    REFRESH name_range.
    name_range = VALUE #( FOR wa IN lt_components ( sign = 'I' option = 'EQ' low = wa-name ) ).

    "Check Mandatory(*)/Hide/Read Only/Optional Attribute Property
    SELECT * FROM zfi_mdg_valt INTO TABLE (it_mdg_val)
          WHERE cr_type = _cr_type AND cr_step = _cr_step AND entity_type = _entity
          AND zmodule = '0G' AND active = 'X'.
    IF sy-subrc = 0.

      LOOP AT ct_fld_prop ASSIGNING FIELD-SYMBOL(<fs_data_2>).
        ASSIGN COMPONENT 'USMD_FP' OF STRUCTURE <fs_data_2> TO FIELD-SYMBOL(<fs_fld_prop_2>).

        LOOP AT it_mdg_val INTO DATA(wa_val) WHERE entity_type = iv_entity. "Traverse Custom Defined Properties

          IF wa_val-condition_tech IS NOT INITIAL. "Check If Condition maintained or free of any condition
            IF  wa_val-condition_tech IN name_range.    "Preventive Action
              READ TABLE it_data ASSIGNING FIELD-SYMBOL(<fs_data_con>)
              WITH KEY (wa_val-condition_tech) = wa_val-condition_val.
              "Condition is not matching, continue with next iteration of properties of it_mdg_val
              IF sy-subrc NE 0.
                CONTINUE.
              ENDIF.
            ELSE.
              CONTINUE.   "Not Valid Condition Attribute/Property
            ENDIF.
          ENDIF.

          "Check for further tech property
          ASSIGN COMPONENT wa_val-tech_name OF STRUCTURE <fs_fld_prop_2> TO FIELD-SYMBOL(<ls_field_2>).
          IF <ls_field_2> IS ASSIGNED.
            <ls_field_2> = wa_val-property.
          ENDIF.
          UNASSIGN  <ls_field_2>.
        ENDLOOP.

        UNASSIGN <fs_fld_prop_2>.
      ENDLOOP.
    ENDIF.

  ENDMETHOD.
       2.  BAdI: USMD_RULE_SERVICE
  • EI: ZFI_ES_MDG_VAL
  • BAdI Implementation: ZFI_MDG_VAL
  • Class: ZCL_FI_MDG_VAL
  • Method: IF_EX_USMD_RULE_SERVICE~CHECK_ENTITY
  METHOD if_ex_usmd_rule_service~check_entity.
