    DATA: lr_model   TYPE REF TO if_usmd_app_context.
    DATA: go_tab_descr   TYPE REF TO cl_abap_tabledescr,
          go_struc_descr TYPE REF TO cl_abap_structdescr,
          lt_components  TYPE abap_component_tab.
    DATA: name_range TYPE RANGE OF zfi_mdg_valt-condition_tech.

    CALL METHOD cl_usmd_app_context=>get_context
      RECEIVING
        eo_context = lr_model.
    IF lr_model IS BOUND.
      CALL METHOD lr_model->get_attributes
        IMPORTING
          ev_crequest_type = DATA(lv_cr_type)
          ev_crequest_step = DATA(lv_cr_step).
    ENDIF.

    "Pre-Exception Handling To Get Valid Fields For it_data As not-valid entry entered in Condition Property
    go_tab_descr ?= cl_abap_tabledescr=>describe_by_data( it_data ).
    CHECK sy-subrc = 0.
    go_struc_descr ?= go_tab_descr->get_table_line_type( ). "Get the structure of your internal table
    lt_components  = go_struc_descr->get_components( ).
    REFRESH name_range.
    name_range = VALUE #( FOR wa IN lt_components ( sign = 'I' option = 'EQ' low = wa-name ) ).

    "Mandatory Check Working for FI : GL,CC,PC
    SELECT * FROM zfi_mdg_valt INTO TABLE (it_zfi_mdg_valderv)
      WHERE cr_type = _cr_type AND cr_step = _cr_step
      AND zmodule = '0G' AND property = 'M' AND active = 'X'.

    LOOP AT it_zfi_mdg_valderv INTO DATA(wa_val).
      LOOP AT it_data ASSIGNING FIELD-SYMBOL(<ls_data>).
        IF <ls_data> IS ASSIGNED.

          IF wa_val-condition_tech IS NOT INITIAL. "Check If Condition maintained or free of any condition
            IF  wa_val-condition_tech IN name_range.    "Preventive Action

              ASSIGN COMPONENT wa_val-condition_tech OF STRUCTURE <ls_data> TO FIELD-SYMBOL(<ls_con>).
              IF <ls_con> IS ASSIGNED AND <ls_con> IS NOT INITIAL.
                IF <ls_con> NE wa_val-condition_val.
                  CONTINUE.
                ENDIF.
                UNASSIGN <ls_con>.
              ENDIF.

            ELSE.
              APPEND VALUE #( msgty = 'E' msgv1 = 'Please check entity name' msgv2 = wa_val-condition_tech   ) TO et_message.
              CONTINUE.
              "msgid = 'zfi_mdg_message'  msgno = 000
            ENDIF.
          ENDIF.

          ASSIGN COMPONENT wa_val-tech_name OF STRUCTURE <ls_data> TO FIELD-SYMBOL(<ls_value>).
          IF <ls_value> IS ASSIGNED AND <ls_value> IS INITIAL.
            APPEND VALUE #( msgid = wa_val-msgid msgty = wa_val-msgty
            msgno = wa_val-msgno msgv1 = wa_val-msgv1 msgv2 = wa_val-msgv2 ) TO et_message.
            UNASSIGN <ls_value>.
          ENDIF.
        ENDIF.

      ENDLOOP.
    ENDLOOP.


  ENDMETHOD.
Output
  1. Scenario I

       1.1. With Loading, Business area is hidden, Profit Center is mandatory, Department & User Responsible are not mandatory.

[ Fig 1.1 : Initial Screen ]

1.2.  With entering Company code = ‘0001’, Department becomes mandatory (*).

[ Fig 1.2 : Department is mandatory ]

2. Scenario II

2.1. For Company code = ‘0003’, Department is not mandatory

[ Fig 2.1 : Department not mandatory ]

3. Scenario III

3.1. With loading, User Responsible is not mandatory by default.

[ Fig 3.1 : User Responsible not mandatory ]

3.2. With Cost center category = ‘%’, User Responsible becomes mandatory.

[ Fig 3.2 : User Responsible mandatory ]

3.3. Click on Check: As Profit Center & User Responsible are blank, we got error messages defined in our Z table.

[ Fig 3.3 : Messages ]

3.4.Errors on Check

[ Fig 3.4 : Messages ]

4. Additional Sanity Check:

To troubleshoot scenario where user has maintained conditional-tech-property/attribute as not-valid property value ( By mistake ; ) So below error will appear on hitting Check.

As we are using this conditional-tech-property to read IT_DATA, it’s safe idea to check pre-hand whether the property is valid and actually present in IT_DATA to refrain from last moment surprises. (or technically a dump ; )

[ Fig. 4.1. Preventive Code ]

[ Fig : 4.2. conditional tech attribute = ‘CCODECCTR1’ is not valid attribute of data model ]

5. Message Class: Generic 000, So No transport required every time for new messages.

[ Fig : 5 Message Class ]

Conclusion

- SAP MDG is built to empower governed, agile master data. But flexibility shouldn’t mean fragility. With a configurable validation engine, we’ve transformed how we think about field behavior turning a developer-led task into a business-led control mechanism and maximum governance.

Thanks !

entry.title: Bringing CDQ to SAP MDG Classic Mode: Enabling Trusted Business Partner Creation with Custom DPI
entry.content:
Executive Summary

SAP MDG classic mode does not support standard DPI integration with CDQ, leaving master data stewards without access to trusted external sources during BP creation.

This blog demonstrates a custom solution that simulates DPI behavior using REST APIs and Custom List UIBB — enabling real-time Business Partner lookup from CDQ inside the Change Request UI. The result is streamlined data entry, improved data accuracy, and more efficient onboarding — even in SAP S/4HANA 2023 (on-premise, classic mode) or earlier versions.

 

Introduction

Creating trusted and error-free business partner records is a critical goal in business. This article explores an approach to achieve that goal by integrating CDQ reference data in SAP Master Data Governance (MDG) classic mode.

SAP introduced Data Provider Integration (DPI) with CDQ AG as a cloud platform, allowing master data stewards to source high-quality business partner data directly from authoritative reference sources. Initially delivered in SAP MDG, cloud edition, this functionality is also available in SAP S/4HANA 2023 under cloud-ready mode.

However, since this out-of-the-box DPI integration is only available in cloud-ready mode on SAP S/4HANA 2023, it creates a functional gap for systems running in classic mode (SAP S/4HANA 2023) as well as for earlier S/4HANA versions.

To bridge this gap and enable external data usage during business partner creation, a custom implementation is needed. This article introduces a solution where CDQ-sourced business partner suggestions are presented dynamically in a Custom List UIBB within the MDG Change Request UI, based on input fields like organization name, address, and tax number.

 

Background

Corporate Data Quality (CDQ) is a cloud-based platform that provides verified company information by connecting to official and commercial registers globally. It allows organizations to source high-quality reference data—such as legal names, addresses, tax numbers, and registration details—during master data creation.

SAP has extended its existing DPI framework to include CDQ as an out-of-the-box data provider, enabling plug-and-play access to trusted business partner data. This is available in:

  • SAP Master Data Governance, cloud edition
  • SAP S/4HANA 2023 (cloud-ready mode)


Figure 1 – Technical view of Data Provider Integration with CDQ

Through this integration, master data stewards can search for business entities directly within the Manage Business Partners Fiori Application, retrieve verified information in real-time, and auto-fill business partner fields. This streamlines onboarding processes, improves data accuracy, and reduces manual maintenance effort.


Figure 2 – Data Provider Integration supporting automation in creation and change of business partner data

For details about DPI, see this SAP Blog.

 

The Limitation: No CDQ DPI in Classic Mode

While the CDQ integration via DPI delivers a streamlined way to source verified business partner data, its standard implementation is currently limited to SAP MDG cloud edition and SAP S/4HANA 2023 (cloud-ready mode). This presents a challenge for organizations using MDG in classic mode or on earlier S/4HANA versions, where the standard DPI configuration and Fiori-based integration are not available.

In such environments, master data stewards often resort to manual data entry, untrusted external sources, increasing the risk of incomplete, inconsistent records—precisely the issues CDQ is meant to solve.

The core challenge becomes:
How can CDQ reference data be leveraged within MDG classic mode, aligning with its Change Request-driven process, even when the standard DPI usage is not supported?

 

Feasible Option - Abstract

The solution presented in this article addresses that challenge by integrating CDQ through a DPI-based approach, enabling real-time access to external data within the MDG classic mode’s Change Request UI using a Custom List UIBB.


Figure 3 – An example screenshot of a Change Request with Custom List UIBB

In this example, the master data steward begins by entering basic input values—e.g., Name 1 and Country/Region—in the Business Partner Details section of the Change Request. As shown in Figure 3, once the user enters Name 1 and Country/Region, the Custom “BP Lookup” List UIBB fetches relevant business partner suggestions from CDQ dynamically.

After selecting the appropriate CDQ-sourced record, the data is transferred into the related sections, as illustrated in Figures 4 and 5.


Figure 4 – Transferred BP Details data retrieved from CDQ into Change Request UI


Figure 5 – Transferred Tax Number data retrieved from CDQ into Change Request UI

 

Some Nice-To-Have Skills

Here are some nice-to-have skills and knowledge areas for handling this topic:

ABAP programming, T-Code: SM59, SM30, STRUST, Cross-Badi derivation, Overview Page Floorplan (OVP), REST API, RFC, MDG

 

Solution in a Nutshell

The solution enables real-time use of CDQ reference data within the SAP MDG Change Request UI through a Custom List UIBB.

As users fill in key fields, such as organization name and/or address, the system fetches potential business partner records from CDQ. The list is updated automatically whenever any parameter is changed. With a single click on ‘Transfer Values’, selected CDQ data is populated into the corresponding MDG fields.

 

Implementation Steps

For our solution, we pursued the following steps:

  • Create an API Key Instance from CDQ with a Client ID and Client Secret. For more information, please visit this site.
  • Import TLS root certificate for https://api.cdq.com. For more information, check out this blog.
  • Maintain the required RFC Destinations to set up technical communication.
  • Determine the logical port as the DPI’s general RFC Destination. Configure the V_MDQDPI_RFCDEST view in SM30.
  • Create these classes to implement the logic;
    1. API Caller Class (ZCL_CDQ_API_CALLER) -> Handling API requests, communicating with CDQ
    2. Main Integration Class (ZCL_CDQ_BP_INTEGRATION) -> Prepare the request data and map the response of the API to the UIBB format
    3. Feeder Class of Custom List UIBB (ZCL_BP_GUIBB_CDQ_FEEDER) -> Maintain the data
    4. Derivation Class (ZCL_BP_CDQ_DERIVATION) -> Populate the related fields with the selected row
    5. Utilities Class (ZCL_BP_CDQ_UTILITIES) -> Collect useful methods that are used several times
  • Add a Custom List UIBB into BS_BP_ALL_OVP.

Create New API Key;


Figure 6 – Generating API Key from CDQ Portal for Secure Integration

To establish secure HTTPS communication with CDQ, the certificate for api.cdq.com must be imported via transaction STRUST. This is depicted in Figure 7, where the certificate is added under the SSL Client (Standard);


Figure 7 – Certification for CDQ API

Set up External Server HTTP Connections;


Figure 8 – RFC Connections for CDQ

The created RFC Destination Z_DPI_CDQ is assigned as the logical port for DPI’s general operation. You can see this configuration in Figure 9, which shows the entry in the V_MDQDPI_RFCDEST view;


Figure 9 – Data entry for V_MDQDPI_RFCDEST to determine logical port for general DPI operations

Remark: The following methods will be the main part of the framework, they do not include the whole picture.

The method responsible for communicating with CDQ (ZCL_CDQ_API_CALLER->CALL_API);

  METHOD call_api.

    TRY.
        DATA(rfc_destination) = get_rfc_destination( if_mdqdpi_rfc_dest_constants=>provider-cdq-operation-general-name ).

        IF rest_client IS NOT BOUND.
          DATA(http_client) = get_http_client( rfc_destination ).

          cl_http_utility=>set_request_uri( request = http_client->request
                                            uri     = api_path ).

          rest_client = NEW cl_rest_http_client( http_client ).
        ENDIF.

      CATCH cx_mdqdpi_functional_error.
        rfc_destination = get_rfc_destination( if_mdqdpi_rfc_dest_constants=>provider-cdq-operation-lookup-name ).
        IF rest_client IS NOT BOUND.
          http_client = get_http_client( rfc_destination ).
          rest_client = NEW cl_rest_http_client( http_client ).
        ENDIF.
        IF rest_client IS INITIAL.
          RAISE EXCEPTION NEW cx_mdqdpi_functional_error( textid = cx_mdqdpi_functional_error=>data_provider_setup_error ).
        ENDIF.
    ENDTRY.

    DATA(request) = build_request( payload = payload
                                   mapping = mapping ).
    rest_client->post( request ).
    result = rest_client->get_response_entity( )->get_string_data( ).
    analyze_response(
      EXPORTING
        string_response  = result
        rest_client      = rest_client                 " REST Client
      IMPORTING
        http_status_code = http_status_code
    ).

    rest_client->close( ).
    CLEAR rest_client.

  ENDMETHOD.

The method responsible for preparing the API response for Custom List UIBB (ZCL_CDQ_BP_INTEGRATION->BP_LOOK_UP);

  METHOD bp_look_up.

    DATA:
      ls_abap_format  TYPE zif_cdq_bp_integration=>gty_look_up_response,
      ls_t100_message TYPE scx_t100key.

    CLEAR:
      ev_http_status_code,
      es_cdq_golden_output,
      et_cdq_output,
      et_t100_message.

    DATA(api_caller) = zcl_cdq_api_caller=>get_instance( ).

    DATA(payload) = prepare_bp_look_up_request(
      EXPORTING
        is_cdq_attr = is_cdq_attr                 " Type for ~ BP Lookup
    ).

    TRY.
        api_caller->call_api(
          EXPORTING
            api_path         = '/sap-odm/v3/referencedata/rest/v3/businesspartners/lookup'
            payload          = payload
          IMPORTING
            result           = DATA(http_response)
            http_status_code = ev_http_status_code
        ).

      CATCH cx_mdqdpi_functional_error INTO DATA(lx_error).

*     General error message info
        CLEAR ls_t100_message.
        ls_t100_message = lx_error->if_t100_message~t100key.
        go_bp_cdq_utilities->prepare_t100_message(
          EXPORTING
            ix_error        = lx_error                 " Functional Errors
          CHANGING
            cs_t100_message = ls_t100_message                 " T100
        ).
        IF ls_t100_message IS NOT INITIAL.
          APPEND ls_t100_message TO et_t100_message.
        ENDIF.

*     Detailed error message info if it exists
        IF lx_error->previous IS NOT INITIAL.
          CLEAR ls_t100_message.
          DATA(lx_previos_error) = CAST cx_mdqdpi_functional_error( lx_error->previous ).
          ls_t100_message = lx_previos_error->if_t100_message~t100key.
          go_bp_cdq_utilities->prepare_t100_message(
            EXPORTING
              ix_error        = lx_previos_error                 " Functional Errors
            CHANGING
              cs_t100_message = ls_t100_message                 " T100
          ).
          IF ls_t100_message IS NOT INITIAL.
            APPEND ls_t100_message TO et_t100_message.
          ENDIF.
        ENDIF.
        EXIT.
    ENDTRY.

    convert_to_abap_format(
      EXPORTING
        iv_data_in_json_format = http_response
        iv_api_type            = 'LOOK_UP'                 " LOOK_UP / BANK_REL / EMAIL
      IMPORTING
        es_look_up_response    = ls_abap_format                 " BP Lookup Response Type
    ).

    convert_to_uibb_format(
      EXPORTING
        is_abap_format       = ls_abap_format
      IMPORTING
        es_cdq_golden_output = es_cdq_golden_output                 " Type for ~ BP Lookup
        et_cdq_output        = et_cdq_output                 " Table Type for ~ BP Lookup
    ).

  ENDMETHOD.

Create a Custom List UIBB to maintain trusted business partner data in Change Request UI;


Figure 10 – Custom List UIBB Component Configuration

 

Conclusion

This solution demonstrates how trusted CDQ reference data can be leveraged in SAP MDG classic mode through a custom DPI-inspired approach. By integrating REST-based API logic into a Custom List UIBB inside the Change Request UI, users can enrich business partner master data in real-time. This makes the solution ideal for on-premise S/4HANA systems aiming to improve data accuracy and reduce manual effort.

entry.title: SAP MDG: How to restrict not req. document type in SAP MDG Change Request (Customer/Supplier) UI?
entry.content:
Hi SCN Folks, 

Note: I didn't add Change Request UI Screenshots.

Faced the Problem:
Configured some Z Document Types. While choosing document types while creating of Change request (It usually displays Custom + Standard Document Types) but i don't want to display standard document types. 

How to solve the problem:
please find below process to clear the faced problem 🙂

Go to the below navigation:
SPRO > Cross-Application Components > Document Management > Control Data > Define DMS Document Types.

Choose the document type & go to the navigation—Define Object Links. Choose the LFA1 & delete it.

As it should not show for the supplier change request.

SAP Master Data Governance 

Thank You, 
Sandeep Suggu.
SAP Community Profile | SAP Profile | LinkedIn

entry.title: SAP MDG: Custom Generic Class for developments
entry.content:
HI SCN Folks, 

Note:
01. There are several ways to implement it, and the blog that's written is one of the ways.
02. There are no screenshots attached related to SAP Logon & SAP MDG UI Screens.
03. In this blog, example which i taken the development of one of the Enhancement UIBB & a Method is GET_DATA.

Faced Problem:
Every time i used to call the below program for different placeholders & for different requirements. In short, making use of the same code again & again.

ZSU_MDG_CL_ENH_CUS_UIBB

DATA :
  lv_cr_number TYPE usmd_crequest,
  lv_crtype    TYPE usmd_crequest_type,
  lv_process   TYPE usmd_process.

DATA(lo_context) = cl_usmd_app_context=>get_context( ).

IF lo_context IS BOUND.
  CALL METHOD lo_context->get_attributes
    IMPORTING
      ev_crequest_id   = lv_cr_number
      ev_crequest_type = lv_crtype
      ev_process       = lv_process.
ENDIF.

IF lv_crtype EQ 'ZSUCRTYPE'.

      "Requirement Logic

ENDIF.

How to reduce this reusability? Please follow the below process

01. Create one custom class.
       ZSU_MDG_CL_GENERIC (Class)

02. Create one Static Method (Level), Public (Visibility) & Exporting Parameters.
        GET_CR_RELATED

  class-methods GET_CR_RELATED
    exporting
      !EO_MODEL type ref to IF_USMD_MODEL_EXT
      !EV_PARENT_PROCESS type USMD_PROCESS
      !EV_PROCESS type USMD_PROCESS
      !EV_WI_ID type SWW_WIID
      !EV_CREQUEST_ID type USMD_CREQUEST
      !EV_CREQUEST_TYPE type USMD_CREQUEST_TYPE
      !EV_CREQUEST_STEP type USMD_CREQUEST_APPSTEP
      !EV_CREQUEST_INDEX type USMD_CREQUEST_WFINDEX
      !EV_EDITION type USMD_EDITION
      !EV_OTC type USMD_OTC .


03. Now enter the below code in the method (Source Code). 

  method GET_CR_RELATED.

      DATA:
      lo_app_ctxt  TYPE REF TO  if_usmd_app_context.


    lo_app_ctxt = cl_usmd_app_context=>get_context( ).

    IF lo_app_ctxt IS BOUND.

      lo_app_ctxt->get_attributes(
       IMPORTING
         eo_model          =  eo_model
         ev_process        =  ev_process
         ev_wi_id          =  ev_wi_id
         ev_crequest_id    =  ev_crequest_id
         ev_crequest_type  =  ev_crequest_type
         ev_crequest_step  =  ev_crequest_step
         ev_crequest_index =  ev_crequest_index
         ev_otc            =  ev_otc
     ).
    ENDIF.

  endmethod.

Done with part of this class (ZSU_MDG_CL_GENERIC). 

Now It's time to use it in any development placeholder; in this blog, implementing it in (ZSU_MDG_CL_ENH_CUS_UIBB).

  DATA: lv_creq_type TYPE usmd_crequest_type,
          lv_wf_step   TYPE usmd_crequest_appstep.


    CALL METHOD ZSU_MDG_CL_GENERIC=>get_cr_related
      IMPORTING
        ev_crequest_type = lv_creq_type  " Type of Change Request
        ev_crequest_step = lv_wf_step.

IF lv_crtype EQ 'ZSUCRTYPE'.
       IF lv_wf_step = '00'.

      "Requirement Logic

ENDIF.
ENDIF.

 

SAP Master Data Governance 

Thank You, 
Sandeep Suggu.
SAP Community Profile | SAP Profile | LinkedIn
